definition: to come thick and fast (idiom)
numerous/confused/disorderly
to arrive/most/to/until
classifier for sheets of papers etc: pile, pad/Taiwan pr. [ta4]
surname Ta
again and again/many
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next

sentences.english: When the couple first dated, there were all kinds of conjectures.
sentences.chinese: 当两人刚开始约会时，各种猜测便纷至沓来。

sentences.english: Build a better mousetrap and the world will beat a path to your door.
sentences.chinese: 放置一个更具吸引力的诱饵，世界的机遇将纷至沓来。

sentences.english: His popularity was so great that he was deluged with honors and invitations to lecture.
sentences.chinese: 盛名之下，荣誉和讲演邀请书纷至沓来。

sentences.english: The star was besieged with invitations to parties.
sentences.chinese: 请明星出席聚会的邀请纷至沓来。
寄给我们的信件纷至沓来。

sentences.english: The most grotesque fantastic conceits haunted him in his bed at night.
sentences.chinese: 夜晚躺在床上的时候，各种离奇怪诞的幻想纷至沓来。

sentences.english: And come in a throng relationship tangled, taught my heart to fear.
sentences.chinese: 而纷至沓来的人际关系纠结，令我心生恐惧。

sentences.english: A few pure electric cars are already offered, and more are coming.
sentences.chinese: 一些纯电力汽车也已经面世，更多的种类纷至沓来。

sentences.english: After using that for one month, there are still thousands of spams in my inbox.
sentences.chinese: 我用了一个月，发现垃圾邮件还是纷至沓来。

sentences.english: The most grotesque and fantastic conceits haunted him in his bed at night.
sentences.chinese: 夜晚躺在床上的时候，各种离奇怪诞的幻想纷至沓来。

sentences.english: So many people entered and I really wish I could reward everybody.
sentences.chinese: 参赛者纷至沓来，我真心希望能够犒赏每一个参与者。

definition: to come one after the other
to follow on sb's heels
more than one can attend to (idiom)/deluged (with inquiries etc)/overwhelmed (by the beauty of the scenery)
continuously; in an endless stream (idiom)
to fall over each other in their eagerness to...
competitive/eagerly/to vie
to gather (in a crowd)/to converge/to swarm
to respond instantly/to act at once on hearing the news
in unbroken succession (idiom)
numerous
brilliant and varied/(often in the combination 精彩纷呈)
to come to a place on account of its reputation (idiom); attracted to visit a famous location
lit. too much for the eye to take in (idiom); a feast for the eyes
to surge like the tide
to emerge in large numbers/to spring up/to emerge prominently
to admire sb's reputation/to seek out famous person or location
